p.k: A fascinating look at the life and career of Jack Nicholson, the Oscar-winning actor whose film credits include Easy Rider, The Shining, A Few Good Men and The Departed

p.n: Mario Lanza: The Best Of Everything
p.k: A biographical portrait of Mario Lanza, the tenor and movie star who rose to fame in the 50s and paved the way for the likes of José Carreras and Plácido Domingo
Enjoy a star-studded event at the Verona Arena honouring the life of tenor Luciano Pavarotti. With touching performances from Placido Domingo
Completely Foolproof Wealthy New Yorker Joe Brisson is a self-made man with a plan to kill his disgruntled wife. Unfortunately for
There's One Born Every Minute Arthur and Margaret are a quiet couple. When Margaret inherits ?50,000, Arthur reluctantly agrees to gamble
An inside look at the architecture behind London's new Design Museum in Kensington, a result of minimalist John Pawson's exquisite vision
A portrait of actor Robert Duvall, who has starred in an array of iconic films and TV projects, including To Kill a Mockingbird, Apocalypse Now and The Godfather
A fascinating look at the life and career of Jack Nicholson, the Oscar-winning actor whose film credits include Easy Rider, The Shining, A Few Good Men and The Departed

p.n: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2019 V (7)
p.k: Semi Final Cromarty The judges have chosen the semi-finalists. Joined by the Wildcard Winner, they're at the banks of the Firth of Cromarty for another challenge
A new bunch of hopefuls pitch their easels as they bid to paint their way to the semi-finals. Mark Gatiss, Georgina Campbell and Tanni Grey-Thompson strike a pose
Places and Faces The photographers travel to four different European capitals to capture the diverse aspects of the continent. David LaChapelle then critiques their work
Movie experts look back at the life and career of Jane Fonda, who won Oscars for her performances in both neo-noir crime-thriller Klute and wartime drama Coming Home
New. An intimate portrait of Peter Finch, the actor known for his portrayal of anchorman Howard Beale in Network, for which he received the first ever posthumous Oscar

p.n: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2019 V (8)
p.k: Final The artists must impress the judges in their toughest challenge yet - a night-painting of the iconic Battersea Power Station for the contest's grand final
Nine more hopefuls get just four hours to make their mark on the judges as they paint Nitin Sawhney, Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Adrian Lester
Parody and Satire From Mel Brooks and 'Weird Al' Yankovic to Spinal Tap and The Simpsons, this episode examines parody and the great humour found in serious subjects
Barry Cryer pays tribute to the heroes of comedy who he has worked with over his many years in the business, starting with Tommy Cooper
